pullRequest.body:
This PR redefines the Weyl group of a root pairing as the subgroup of automorphisms generated by reflection morphisms. The new definition is isomorphic to the old one, by faithfulness of the weight space representation, but we also get a natural coweight space representation and permutation representation on roots.

---

It occurs to me seeing this that we could make life easier here (and throughout this file) by proving stronger extensionality lemmas for `RootPairing.Hom` and `RootPairing.Equiv` (and dropping the `@[ext]` decorator from the `structure` declarations to free up the name).

I guess these extensionality lemmas would be heterogeneous versions of `RootPairing.weightHom_injective` and `RootPairing.coweightHom_injective` (which we would keep but with one-line proofs). IIUC these would read:
```lean
@[ext] protected lemma Hom.ext {x y : RootPairing.Hom P Q} (h : x.weightMap = y.weightMap) :
    x = y := by
  sorry

-- Cannot carry `ext` attribute but I guess worth having for symmetry.
protected lemma Hom.ext' {x y : RootPairing.Hom P Q} (h : x.coweightMap = y.coweightMap) :
    x = y := by
  sorry
```
Anyway, this is all a bit of a detour and need not be done now, I just thought I'd mention it.
